# Assignment 1

::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_2a64dcaec1e8e077dbcb19c2c466381c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
T_S<-0.2
T0_S<-0.8
T_S0<-0.6
T0_S0<-0.4
S<-0.3
S0<-0.7

P_T_S<-T_S * S
P_T_S0<-T_S0 * S0
P_T0_S<-T0_S * S
P_T0_S0<-T0_S0 * S0

print(P_T_S)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.06
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(P_T_S0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.42
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(P_T0_S)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.24
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(P_T0_S0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.28
```
:::
:::

# Assignment 2
* What is the percentage of customers using all three devices?
    + 0,5%
* What is the percentage of customers using at least two devices?
    + 0,5% + 3,3% + 7,3% + 8,8% = 19,9%
* What is the percentage of customers using only one device?
    + 100% - 19,9% = 80,1%

# Assignment 3


::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_bf008db67fb938b9b528a99ec1228a08'}

```{.r .cell-code}
P_A<-0.04
P_A0<-1-P_A
P_BA<-0.97
P_BA0<-0.01

P_B<-P_BA*P_A+P_BA0*P_A0
P_AB<-(P_BA*P_A)/P_B
P_A0B<-(P_BA0*P_A0)/P_B

print(P_B)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.0484
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(P_AB)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.8016529
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(P_A0B)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 0.1983471
```
:::
:::

These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a possibility of about 19,83% that the product is flawless and a probability of 80,17% that the product is faulty.
